summary: The 'Rural Health Focus Act' aims to improve healthcare in rural areas. It directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish an Office of Rural Health within the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). This office, led by a director, will focus on research related to rural health issues, improve access to services (including telehealth), identify healthcare disparities, award grants, and coordinate with other federal agencies to avoid duplication of efforts and promote healthier outcomes for rural populations.
